result.execSummary:
The defendant Caleb K Roth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
To pay costs of $243  plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443  
The costs and fees of Counts #1 & #2, totaling $886 is to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 8/31/15 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a   18 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

--serve 120  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for purposes of employment including apprenticeship, education and treatment; to commence FORTHWITH.

--Mr. Roth is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served, with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

--This sentence can be transferred to Dane Co. so long as there is no use of electronic monitoring

Concurrent with: with Count #2

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case called at 8:44am [mo]
Defendant Caleb K Roth in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing arguments by Counsel
--ADA Shock submits Victim Impact Statement
Statement made by Mr. Roth

On Counts #1 & #2 of the Amended Information, The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 120  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for purposes of employment including apprenticeship, education and treatment; to commence FORTHWITH.
--Mr. Roth is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served, with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--This sentence can be transferred to Dane Co. so long as there is no use of electronic monitoring
--0 days credit for time already served given
--On Count #1: pay costs of $243  plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443  
--On Count #2: pay costs of $243  plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 

The costs and fees of Counts #1 & #2, totalling $886 is to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 8/31/15 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a   18 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
recess: 9:07am
[off record/post hearing: The Clerk inquires of the Court whether the sentences in Count #1 and Count #2 are concurrent or consecutive. The Court orders the sentence in Counts #1 & #2 to be served conccurent with eachother]
Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa
Sentencing hearing on July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.
Scheduling notice

Case called at 1:28pm [mo]
Court Reporter: Lisa Zinda
Defendant Caleb K Roth in court with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

DA Happ submits Amended Information
--admit service; waive reading

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1 and #2 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads- in and dismisses: Count #3 in the Amended Information

Attorney Zarwell requests an adjourned sentencing date, in early July.
The State has no objection

The Court indicates to Mr. Roth to expect a forthwith sentence, since the sentencing date it being adjourned.
recess: 1:39pm

[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews case file documents and indicates that notices were sent to Dane County Huber - was returned with note that indicates Return to Sender. Court's JA noted that notice was sent there as an FYI and that the Dane County Jail confirmed address. Unclear on this message.
Atty Zarwell presents surprise at Mr. Roth's non-appearance as he has been attentive to matter & have had numerous contacts with Mr. Roth
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Zarwell indicates that she is not aware of current address for Mr. Roth
Court informs Atty Zarwell to attempt to call Defendant - off-record: 3:25 - 3:28 pm for 
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that she left Mr. Roth a voicemail
Court presents inclination to issue warrant but STAY warrant until EOB Monday 
ADA Hall: No objection
Court orders issuance of bench warrant - Body Only and STAYS warrant until EOB Monday, December 8th.
